snippet: Edward J. DeMarco, acting director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency, has been at odds with the White House over a proposal to reduce the principal on underwater mortgages.
abstract: Prominent state attorneys general call on Pres Obama to fire Edward J DeMarco, saying his tenure as acting director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency has slowed economic recovery; agency, which oversees Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, has refused to reduce principal on underwater mortgages, move that might expose taxpayers to additional losses.
lead_paragraph: Edward J. DeMarco, acting director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency, has been at odds with the White House over a proposal to reduce the principal on underwater mortgages.

headline.seo: Attorneys General Press White House to Fire F.H.F.A. Chief
headline.main: White House Urged to Fire a Housing Regulator
headline.print_headline: White House Urged to Fire A Housing Regulator

keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
keywords.name: organizations
